scheme_name: Fish Farming Diversification (Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribe) Scheme
brief_description: The scheme aims to promote sustainable livelihoods for Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe communities through fishery-based diversified activities. Under this scheme, a 60% subsidy is provided to eligible fish farmers for pond renovation & integrated fish farming (duck/poultry/fruit plantation).
detailed_description: The scheme &quot;Fish Farming Diversification (Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe) Scheme&quot; was launched by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote sustainable livelihoods for Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe communities through fishery-based diversified activities. Under this scheme, a 60% subsidy is provided to eligible fish farmers for pond renovation, integrated fish farming (duck/poultry/fruit plantation), and mobile fish stalls to support fish processing and marketing.
benefits: ₹42,000/- subsidy (60%) for 100 sq. meter pond (total cost: ₹70,000/-). ₹3,00,000/- subsidy (60%) for 1.0 hectare pond in plain areas (total cost: ₹5,00,000/-).
Note: Fish farmers who already have a pond and are involved in fish/poultry farming and other integrated activities receive a 60% subsidy.
₹83,000/- subsidy (60%) for 1 unit in hilly areas (total cost: ₹1,39,000/-). ₹3,96,000/- subsidy (60%) for 1 unit in plain areas (total cost: ₹6,60,000/-).
₹1,50,000/- subsidy (60%) against ₹2,50,000/- cost for landless individuals for fish marketing.
Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the beneficiary's bank account.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a native of Uttarakhand. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe community. The applicant should be engaged in fish production and possess a pond or be landless and interested in engaging in fish processing or marketing businesses to be eligible.

steps: Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the district-level office of the Assistant Director of Fisheries/District Fisheries Officer and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the district-level office of the Assistant Director of Fisheries/District Fisheries Officer. Post-application Process: Step 1: A field survey is conducted by fisheries inspectors in coordination with the applicant. Step 2: A proposal is prepared and approved by the concerned district-level officer. Step 3: The applicant executes the work (pond renovation, integrated unit, or mobile stall) under field staff guidance. Step 4: Upon completion, a work completion certificate is issued. Step 5: The subsidy amount (60% of the approved cost) is credited to the applicant's bank account via DBT.
Step 1: Visit to e-Services Apuni Sarkar ( https://eservices.uk.gov.in ) and click "Sign Up" on the Citizen Login page.
Step 2: Fill in the registration form with your name, email, mobile number, etc., and click Submit.
Step 3: You will receive your User ID and password via SMS on your registered mobile number.
Step 1: Navigate to the Citizen Login page and enter your User ID (email or mobile) and password, complete the captcha, then click Sign In.
Step 2: Once logged in, your dashboard appears. Click "Apply for New Application" or similar to begin.
Step 3: Choose the Fisheries department, from the list, select the specific scheme you wish to apply for.
Step 4: The portal will list mandatory documents required and upload mandatory documents, after uploading, click Submit to proceed.
Step 5: Enter all required details in the form (personal, land, bank, etc.). Use Save to save progress, preview to review, or Delete Draft to reset.
Step 6: Once all fields are accurately filled, click Submit. You will receive an Application ID receipt, which you can download.
Step 1: The application goes to the concerned department for review.
Step 2: You can track your application status on the portal using your Application ID.

documents_required:
Applicant Photo Aadhaar Card Land Documents (Khasra Khatauni of land for pond owners) Permanent Residence Certificate Caste Certificate Bank Account Details Mobile Number Pond Details (for those with existing ponds) Photo of Site
NOTE: For landless applicants: Pond details and land documents not required.
